website_summaries.verdict: The Koss SP330 headphones are solid performers that will add a full signature to your music, but some audiophiles may find their design too basic for everyday use.
pros: The Koss SP330s are super-lightweight with the added convenience of a detachable cable, while their neutral soundstage amplifies a warm tonal response and tight, punchy bass
cons: Some users may experience ear fatigue due to the minimal padding underneath the headband
Also, the headphones don't fold up, and the cable doesn't have a microphone or remote control built in

customer_reviews.title: Sp330
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality good but kph30i better Surprisingly comfortable great on the go Ower all better then most overpriced one Update With eq sound amazing i had to boost the midrange paw 5000 ii pairs good Wery good portable system Update 7/11/2020 I modified with the kph30i drivers I get a bass monster headphones with wery good midrange and a little bit recessed highs now this is a closed portable porta pro
customer_reviews.author: Makkai Gyula

customer_reviews.title: Not great sound but very comfy
customer_reviews.text: The sound is heavy on the treble and virtually no bass. Reminds me of sound you got from those orange Walkman headphones from the '80s. But they are comfortable and you can wear them all day. I use them on my laptop for Zoom meetings. They're reasonably well made and serve their purpose well. If you want high quality sound then don't get these but if you need headphones for Zoom meetings and occasionally listening to music at work then these will do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Best for listening to speech, not music
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for listening to talk programs, and I think that they are ideally suited for that purpose because their frequency output is strongest in the high range and weakest in the low range. That weakness in the bass frequencies however make them a poor choice for listening to music in my opinion. Also the jack for the insertion of the plug is recessed into a 6 mm. diameter hole which means that the headphones will not accept a standard patch cord plug unless you first file or grind the back part of the plug down to 5.5 mm. diameter or smaller.
customer_reviews.author: SillyConVal

customer_reviews.title: Earpiece fell off right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The left earpiece was loose right out of the box, and soon fell off and was dangling from the internal earpiece cable. I returned them immediately. Another reviewer on Koss's own website mentions the same problem, so I take it this is somewhat of a frequent issue with these headphones, which is a shame because sound quality was very nice for the few minutes I tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Noumena

customer_reviews.title: The fit on these headphones is amazing. The frequency response is about the same as ...
customer_reviews.text: These Koss Headphones are the 1st new design in years I purchased this item to compliment my Koss Port a Pro headphones. The fit on these headphones is amazing. The frequency response is about the same as the Port a Pros but the midrange appears to be more subtle Over all I would highly recommend the Koss Headphones I use mine for walking/jogging with my Sony Walkman Radio
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: These really are as good as Tyll Hertsens claims
customer_reviews.text: These really are as good as Tyll Hertsens claims. Easy to drive and comfortable. My main listening is heavy rock but also jazz, blues, reggae, and some classical. I love bass, but NOT overblown stuff at 100 Hz! With most headphones, I use the equalizer on my iPod Classic or Astell & Kern AK120 II, but these sound great completely unequalized. (I only listen to WAV, lossless files or hi-rez files.)
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Garland, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: love the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: love the sound quality. and the unlimited lifetime warranty. only downside is that the ears start to hurt after long periods of use
customer_reviews.author: doctor pikachu

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but is to poorly made to cost more than ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great but is to poorly made to cost more than maybe $50.00 so I sent it back to Amazon It does come with a nice case though
customer_reviews.author: L. Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these headphones! They block out a lot of the background noise created by the rest of my family while I'm using them for my transcription work and they are comfortable to wear, even with my glasses on---that's no small feat!
customer_reviews.author: RDow

customer_reviews.title: These are amazingly good sounding headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are amazingly good sounding headphones for the price. They sound almost exactly the same, in every significant way, to my older Sennheiser HD 580 headphones, except that they may have a little more bass extension, if you get a good seal on your ears. I think I would describe the sound quality as being very neutral, and wide range - like a good pair of near-field monitor loudspeakers. I like the plug-in stereo cord. If you need to replace it, or want to change it's length, just buy any stereo cord with 1/8th inch plugs from any electronics supply store. You can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two months
customer_reviews.text: I am not particularly rough, but a connection above the earpad broke. For this price plastic construction seems shoddy. Too bad; otherwise comfortable and decent-sounding.
customer_reviews.author: VicinSF

customer_reviews.title: Female voices were severely attenuated and sounded like they were in a barrel
customer_reviews.text: Sounded awful. Female voices were severely attenuated and sounded like they were in a barrel.Very disappointing. Worst headphone I've heard.
customer_reviews.author: Vade Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me by an "audiophile" friend
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a piece of cr*p. Recommended to me by an "audiophile" friend, their sound is inferior to my cheap Panasonic ones. It is thick, cushiony, muffled-sounding. The coup-de-grace: on my first use of them, they fell apart: ear piece fell off from head piece and refused to re-connect. Do NOT make the mistake I made by buying these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: SP330 and SP540 Love them both!
customer_reviews.text: I have both the SP540 and the SP330 models. Love how comfortable both of these fit. Here's where they differ. I can see using the SP540 for travel (plane, train, bus) and SP330 for travel (car). There is more background noise on planes, trains and buses than in the car. The SP540 fits over the entire ear where the SP330 model just sits onto of the ear. So if there is background noise you definitely want the SP540. Another place I think the SP540 would benefit over the SP330 is the coffee shop or the beach where there is a lot of background noise. Both fit nicely into a carry case for compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: Parker-Moore Family

customer_reviews.title: The on the ear style is a bit annoying. I prefer over the ear
customer_reviews.text: The on the ear style is a bit annoying. I prefer over the ear. I base all headphone's sound quality to the Sony MDRV6 Studio Monitor Headphones. The sony's have unparalleled sound and they are quite affordable. As for the Koss, These sound great. As good as the sony's but about 20 bucks more in price. The only issue I had was if your moving around you can hear popping sounds when the headphones move about on your head. Other than that pretty solid!
customer_reviews.author: John Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: The left earphone fell off just after unpacking! I am keeping my 21-year old "KOSS Porta Pro Jr" but I am afraid I will never buy a KOSS product again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I have the Koss porta pros and I love them, and I do not believe that the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the Koss porta pros and I love them, and I do not believe that the sp330 are much better than the Porta pro's The sp330 look and feel sturdy and I like that. The sound is ok compared to the Porta Pro's, cushion feels excellent and they do keep outside noise out. The Porta pros leak out a huge amount of sound , but the SP330 do not leak that much sound . I hate to say it but the Porta pros are just as good as the sp330 for more than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: nevhtur

customer_reviews.title: Extremly bad quality. I wore them exclusively in office
customer_reviews.text: Extremly bad quality. I wore them exclusively in office, and they fell apart after only 10 months. Wrote mail to Koss support, they didn't even reply. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: mr.k.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Comfortable, Would recommend.  They are rivals for my sony
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. Comfortable. Great sound. Highly recommend. I like listening to music in these better the buds because the sounds is better
customer_reviews.author: TC

product_meta.title: Koss SP330 On Ear Dynamic Headphones Black with Silver Accents
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingEscape with the new on-ear dynamic SP330 headphones by Koss, inventors of the world's first SP/3 Stereo phone in 1958. The SP330's natural fitting, unique D-profile echoes the shape of the ear, perfecting sound, fit and comfort. The lightweight design lets you feel the music, not the headphones, creating a streamlined immersive experience. A single entry, detectable cable adds versatility, perfect for quick storage and portability. The D-profile, contour cushion closes gaps around the ear, improving comfort, fit, isolation and sound.
feature_bullets: Unique D-Profile echoes the shape of the ear, perfecting sound and fit
Detachable single-entry cable adds versatility for quick storage and portability
Metal reinforced pivots provide added strength and support
Contour Sealing Cushion - the unique D-profile closes gaps around the ear, improving comfort, fit, isolation, and sound
Koss PLX30 Dynamic Element precisely tuned to feature crisp highs, robust mids and smooth lows for the ultimate personal listening experience
